title.narrative: MONITORING AND EVALUATION FOR NUTRITION

description.narrative: Government at national and sub-national level have strengthened capacity for evidence based policy development, multi sectoral coordination, planning, budgeting, implementation, monitoring and evaluation for nutrition., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Early Detection And Treatment Of Malnutrition, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being, Nutrition In Early Childhood, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Supply And Logistics. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: NUTRITION Outcome: Improved coverage and increased utilization of quality and equitable nutrition services for under five children, adolescent girls and mothers in most deprived provinces and areas.

participating-org.narrative: DOPH TAKHAR DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH
FOOD AND AGRICULTURE ORGANIZATION OF THE UNITED NATIONS

Technical assistance - Nutrition in early childhood

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government at national and sub-national level have strengthened capacity for evidence based policy development, multi sectoralcoordination, planning, budgeting, implementation, monitoring and evaluation for nutrition.

description.narrative: UNICEF adjusted to key changes in government and COVID-19 context by supporting initiatives to guide service delivery adaptation in technical areas ensuring continuation of services for women and children, enhancing information and supply systems, improving the enabling environment, and generating evidence on interventions to improve service delivery quality.The Global Action Plan for;addressing wasting;(GAP);is approved by theAfghanistan Food;Security and Nutrition;(AFSeN)high level executive committee; however,;theimplementationis on halt due to the government collapse;and UNICEF changed work modality with thecurrentgovernment. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:12/01/2022
